p:
The amount of β-eudesmol detected (4.11%) was slightly lower than that found in the essential oil previously prepared (5.22%) by Ebrahimi et al.
29 . This small difference may be connected to the different habitat and altitude in which the same plant was grown. β-Eudesmol has been used in traditional medicine mainly because of its diuretic, anti-hypertensive, antipyretic, antiseptic and antimicrobial properties
45– 47 .
